data.title: St. Louis County Library
data.text:
What's Happening @ SLCL

All News

"Diane Von Furstenberg: Woman in Charge" Screening and Cocktail Reception

St. Louis County Library and Saint Louis Fashion Fund will host a ticketed reception and screening of "Diane von Furstenberg: Woman in Charge" on Tuesday, July 23 at 5:30 p.m. at the Post Event Space at the Clark Family Branch. The evening kicks off with a red-carpet cocktail reception at 5:30 p.m., followed by the screening at 7:00 p.m. Guests are encouraged to "Wear DVF" or something with color or pattern, like many of her iconic wrap dresses. Tickets are $25 per person and can be purchased through Eventbrite.

Novel Creations Pop-Up Market Series

The Novel Creations Pop-Up Market Series is an immersive eight-week marketing course crafted to jump into the realms of visual merchandising, direct and viral marketing, brand construction, and promotional material design, culminating in a public pop-up market. Applications will be accepted July 20-August 20.

Fresh Produce Available at 3 Branches

St. Louis County Library will provide fresh produce boxes at Florissant Valley, Lewis & Clark and Weber Road on Thursday, July 18 and Thursday, July 25 starting at 8:30 a.m. Boxes are distributed curbside in branch parking lots. There is a limit of one box per vehicle, and supplies are limited.

Backstage Pass: Introducing The Rep's New Studio Season

Be the first to know as The Rep unveils their Steve Woolf Studio Series season, featuring adventurous productions that push the boundaries of storytelling. Discover the excitement and unforgettable moments awaiting you at The Rep with immersive and entertaining sneak peeks of the upcoming mainstage and studio productions.
